channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2023070079
item.description:
Report E-2023070079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pail of Shock granular (un2880) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 pounds of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN OUTBOUNDS INA RED HAZ TOTE LEAKING. IT WAS BROUGHT TO QA DUE TO HAZ LABELING AND SENT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR INSPECTION DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP AND CONTENTS LEAKED OUT DURING TRANSPORTATION. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report E-2023070067
item.description:
Report E-2023070067

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer forklift operator puncture a drum that was already staged in the trailer with the forkblades on their forklift consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent material and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061589
item.description:
Report X-2023061589

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA in hazardous material tote. There is a wet corroded spot on the top/side of the box. I put on proper PPE so I can open the box to see what is leaking and began my process for damaged Hazmat. DescribePack: One of the containers were leaking due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was kept upright then moved into a sealed drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061510
item.description:
Report X-2023061510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023061510 SequenceEvent: The package was already in QA in the hazardous material red tote. The box was on its side instead of being upright as the arrow suggested. I put on proper PPE and turn the box upright. The side of the box that was on the bottom were soaked in the liquid solution that leaks from the inside. DescribePack: There is no visible damage to the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept them upright and moved liquids that leaked out into a sealed drum. 2. X-2023061511 SequenceEvent: The package was already in QA in the hazardous material red tote. The box was on its side instead of being upright as the arrow suggested. I put on proper PPE and turn the box upright. The side of the box that was on the bottom were soaked in the liquid solution that leaks from the inside. DescribePack: There is no visible damage to the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept them upright and moved liquids that leaked out into a sealed drum. 3. X-2023061512 SequenceEvent: The package was already in QA in the hazardous material red tote. The box was on its side instead of being upright as the arrow suggested. I put on proper PPE and turn the box upright. The side of the box that was on the bottom were soaked in the liquid solution that leaks from the inside. DescribePack: There is no visible damage to the drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept them upright and moved liquids that leaked out into a sealed drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061496
item.description:
Report X-2023061496

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles coil clean. 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of coil clean had a loose cap allowing .10 gallons to release. The other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of coil clean were not damaged. No slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed, contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 gallon plastic bottle of coil clean had a loose cap leaking out .10 gallons of liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061481
item.description:
Report X-2023061481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found in trailer # 823431 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 5 liter plastic bottles of medivators rapicide pa parts a and b two 5 liter plastic bottles had loose caps allowing all 5 liters from each bottle to release package did have slotted partitions and a inner box no bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two 5 liters plastic bottles of part B medivators rapicidepa had loose caps allowing all 5 liters from each bottle to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023061473
item.description:
Report X-2023061473

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-11
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged hazmat was in a red hazardous bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the box. The box was extremely wet on the bottom of the box. Kept the package upright. DescribePack: The plastic jerrican was in a plastic bag with a zip tie to keep it in the bag. I turned the Jerrican on its side to see where the leak was coming from. It came from the cap; more liquid came out when it wasn't upright. I also noticed that there was tape all over the cap. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: Kept upright to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023061472
item.description:
Report X-2023061472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was punctured by a sharp object when it was being loaded on to a truck. The object went through the box and the plastic bottle causing the hazardous fluid to leak. A manager then placed the package into a bin to the liquid from spreading. DescribePack: The bottom of the package was punctured by a sharp object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a bin to stop the spreading and then put into the damage hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023061274
item.description:
Report X-2023061274

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: PHOENIXVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A driver returned from the route and marked the package as refused. The package was wet and promptly taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, it was discovered that the cap of one of the bottles was slightly loose, leading to spillage. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were cleaned of the material. The spill was contained in the box so no external cleanup was required.

item.title: Report X-2023061244
item.description:
Report X-2023061244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-18
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager came to QA to alert an admin that a hazmat package has fallen off the NC belt. We quickly grabbed the hazardous material tote and the P9 along with proper PPE. There was a spill on the floor, so we blocked off the area and began our cleanup. Once everything was in a drum and tote, it was brought over to the vent in the Hazmat Cage for further inspection and to have it processed for ISF/DPR/HESS. DescribePack: Cap fell off the bottle after impact with the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kept the bottle upright in a tote and now into a drum, sealed.

item.title: Report I-2023060128
item.description:
Report I-2023060128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-27
  • City: Montrose
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPRESS NATURAL GAS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The natural gas powered tractor was experienceing a minor fuel system leak and the gas was venting under the trailer which raised a potential fire hazard. In consultation with the local Fire Department it was decided to vent off the gas in the the trailer. There was no fire as a result of this incident.
